content: Can you catch a cold from being out in cold weather?

No, you cannot catch a cold from being out in cold weather. Colds are caused by viruses, not by cold temperatures. However, spending time in cold weather might make you more susceptible to catching a virus if you're already exposed to one, possibly because cold air can affect your immune system's ability to fight off infections. It's still important to stay warm and dry to maintain overall health and comfort.
